results.title: Highways challenge
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, John Kingsford-Smith and Jack Gardiner
results.brief_description: This film deals with Australia’s road problems. Describes how each member of the public is dependent upon road transport and points out that poor roads increase prices. Shows how cheaper methods of road transport can eventually be more costly. Suggests that the correct approach to the problem is lacking and offers a solution. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Highway improvements
results.brief_description: Details of planning and improvements of Victorian state highways, including climbing lanes for slow traffic, duplicate pavements, elimination of railroad crossings and development of by-pass roads.

results.title: Highlights of the United Nations year 1947-48
results.brief_description: UNO’s activities during 1947-48 included: partition of Palestine; building a headquarters for UNO; combating a cholera outbreak in Egypt; sending wool from Australia to Poland; attending the funeral of Mahatma Ghandi; Mutual Aid Conference in India; truce in Indonesia; sending 2,500 displaced persons to Venezuela under IRO sponsorship; launching the International Children’s Emergency Fund plans to send 140 million pounds worth of food and clothing and medical supplies for use in Asia and Europe.

results.title: Highlights Edinburgh 1986 Commonwealth Games
results.brief_description: Ten days of vivid emotion, colour and competition are captured on this specially compiled video containing highlights of the X111th Commonwealth Games held in Edinburgh, Scotland. All ten sports are featured and there are many memorable moments as athletes achieve long hoped for success or experience the pain of defeat.

results.title: Highlights 1965: a progress report (NASA)
results.creator_credit: Norwood Studios, United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration and Lewis Baer
results.brief_description: Explains the programs and achievements which were carried out by NASA in 1965. Programs included weather and communication satellites, observatory satellites, deep space probes and manned space flight. The film also shows the participation of countries around the world in these projects.

results.title: Highlands of the Andes
results.creator_credit: Jules Bucher, United World Films and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
A description of the Andes of Peru and the mineral resources of the area. Shows the people working in the gold, silver and copper mines, also farmers cultivating the poor, rocky soil.

results.title: Highlands of New Guinea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
Social and economic changes in the Western Highlands of Papua New Guinea as demonstrated in the construction of an airstrip at Lake Kopiagu and the first Mount Hagen Show. Credits include Stanley Hawes, Frank Bagnall, Maslyn William, Shan Benson, Dennis Hill and Robert Gibbs.

results.title: Highlander [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Highlander Productions, Peter S. Davis, William N Panzer and Russell Mulcahy
results.brief_description: From the dawn of time there has been the immortals, destined to live forever and compete for the ultimate prize, duelling against one another until there is only one left with power beyond imagination. Only decapitation can end their immortality. Set in contemporary Manhatten, this fantasy saga follows Highlander Connor Macleod (Christopher Lambert) in a battle against his eternal enemy and main contender for the prize, The Kurgan (Clancy Brown). After being arrested by the police for a fracas in an underground carpark which results in a headless body, Connor must also contend with the inundation of questions, and challenge the notion that immortals cannot fall in love. Connor discovers he is one of the immortals when he is “killed” during a battle in the Scottish highlands by The Kurgan, but miraculously does not die. He learns of his status by fellow immortal Ramirez (Sean Connery), who must cede his immortality by decapitation to make way for a superior contender to battle for the prize. This cult classic makes effective use of flashbacks between past and present and spawned many less superior sequels. Cast includes also Roxanne Hart, Beatie Edney and Alan North. Soundtrack by Queen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Highlander Productions, Peter S. Davis, William N Panzer and Russell Mulcahy

results.title: Highland winter
results.creator_credit: Wilderness Society, Kath Scholes, Nick Housego and Roger Scholes
results.brief_description: An elderly woman living in a nursing home recalls images of the wild and isolated land she is no longer able to visit. The film recalls the winter journeys of her childhood in the Central Highlands of Tasmania. With Emily Talbot Higgins.

results.title: Highland indians of Peru
results.brief_description: Discusses the plight of the Peruvian Indian and shows the slum life in the city and the primitive life in the highlands. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
